how can i dont gitignore all of the .gitkeep file in every folders and its subfolders?
To exclude all `.gitkeep` files from being ignored (i.e., to track them) even if they are in different folders and subfolders, you can add this line to your `.gitignore` file:

```
!.gitkeep
```

The `!` symbol acts as a negation, telling Git to NOT ignore these files, even if they would otherwise be ignored by other rules.

If you have other rules that might be catching these files, make sure this rule comes after those rules. For example:

```
# Ignore all files in empty directories
*
# But don't ignore .gitkeep files
!.gitkeep
```

This will keep tracking all `.gitkeep` files throughout your repository, regardless of their location in the folder structure.

Note: If you have any parent directories that are ignored, you'll need to also add negation rules for those directories. For example:

```
# Ignore all files in empty directories
*
# Don't ignore directories
!*/
# Don't ignore .gitkeep files
!.gitkeep
```

This ensures that Git can traverse through the directories to find the `.gitkeep` files.
